page.title: 15LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: IN{1871}THE POPULATION OF{WOODLEY}WAS {968.}OF PRIVATE RESIDENCES{BULMERSHE {COURT}WAS THE LARGEST,{GEORGIAN HOUSE BUILT IN{1777}BY A MEMBER OF THE {WHEBLE}FAMILY. IT WAS AT ONE TIME OCCUPIED BY THE{SPEAKER}OF THE{HOUSE {OF COMMONS, HENRY ADDINGTON.}THE OLDER HOUSES ARE RAPIDLY DISAPPEARING FROM THE{WOODLEY}SCENE. HOLY SERVICES WERE READ IN THE{CHURCH OF ENGLAND SCHOOL SOON AFTER IT'S ERRECTION IN{1855. SOON AFTER THE WAR THE{100 ACRE}FIELD WAS SOLD FOR THE PURPOSE OF A{FLYING {SCHOOL. DOUGLAS BADER}CRASHED ON {WOODLEY AIRFIELD}WHERE HE LOST HIS LEGS. HE THEN CAME BACK IN{1965}TO OPEN THE{COMMUNITY HALL. BULMERSHE {COURT}WAS{DEMOLISHED}AND{BULMERSHE {COLLEGE}WAS BUILT IN IT'S PLACE.
